record.field: Strategic Objective 1: Enhance Kampala City economic Growth

Enhance Kampala City economic Growth through:

  • Agro-Industrialization
  • Private Sector Development
  • Integrated Transport Infrastructure and Services
  • Development Plan Implementation
  • Tourism Development
  • Natural Resources, Environment, Climate Change, Water and Land Management
  • Sustainable Urbanization and Housing
  • Digital Transformation
  • Sustainable Energy Development

Implemented by 5 directorates: Production & Commercial Services, Engineering, Revenue Administration, Physical Planning, and ICT.
Strategic Objective 2: Increase productivity, inclusiveness and wellbeing of Population

Increase productivity, inclusiveness and wellbeing of Population through:

  • Human Capital Development programme
  • Sustainable Energy Development

Implemented by 3 directorates: Public Health, Education & Sports, and Gender & Community Services.
Strategic Objective 3: Strengthen the oversight and governance function for effective service delivery by the city

Strengthen the oversight and governance function in the city through:

  • Legislation, Oversight and Representation
  • Administration of Justice
  • Governance and Security

Implemented by 2 directorates: Legislative & Political Affairs and Legal Affairs.
Strategic Objective 4: Mainstream action on city climate resilience

Mainstream action on city climate resilience through:

  • Development Plan Implementation (cross-cutting)
  • Digital Transformation (cross-cutting)

Implemented by 2 directorates: Treasury Services and Human Resource & Organizational Development.
Strategic Objective 5: Strengthen institutional capacity to drive organizational excellence

Strengthen institutional capacity to drive organizational excellence through:

  • Natural Resources, Environment, Climate Change, Water and Land Management (cross-cutting)
  • Development Plan Implementation (cross-cutting)
  • Public Sector Transformation

Implemented by 4 directorates: Treasury Services, Human Resource & Organizational Development, Administration & ICT, and Internal Audit.
